title: Bulgaria does not have racism problem but English football does, says head coach Krassimir Balakov on eve of qualifier
text:
Bulgaria head coach Krassimir Balakov has claimed it is English football and not his own country that has a widespread problem with racism.

England will play Bulgaria in a partially closed Vasil Levski Stadium on Monday night after the hosts were punished by Uefa for what European football’s governing body deemed was racist behaviour by their fans in the Euro 2020 qualifying games against Kosovo and Czech Republic.

Gareth Southgate held a meeting before the trips to Czech Republic and Sofia to talk his squad through the three-step Uefa protocol they should follow if any of them hear racist abuse.

Striker Tammy Abraham also spoke of walking off the pitch, which prompted an angry response from Borislav Mihaylov, the president of the Bulgarian Football Union, who wrote to Uefa to complain about the matter.

And asked whether or not he felt Bulgarian football had a problem with racism, Balakov said: “What I can say is that I don’t think we have a problem in the Bulgarian championship. We have a lot of players of different ethnicities and skin colour. I don’t think we have as a big a problem like, for example, England do.

“In the Bulgarian championship, we have not had such problems while there have been incidents in all levels of English football involving racism. I consider that something normal because it is a big country with a very diverse population. But we don’t have this problem in Bulgaria - I can assure you of that.”
description: Bulgaria head coach Krassimir Balakov has claimed it is English football and not his own country that has a widespread problem with racism.
